results.title: Bamboozled [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Spike Lee, Jon Kilik and 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks
results.brief_description: Shot on digital video (by cinematographer Ellen Kuras) and taking it’s title from a Malcolm X speech (“You’ve been led astray, led amok, you’ve been bamboozled”), Spike Lee’s “Bamboozled” is an ambitious and contentious satire, a dazzling balancing act that at times strains under it’s own ingenuity but never fails to provoke and challenge. Damon Wayans stars as a successful and affected television executive, Pierre Delacroix, who is pressured by his wannabe home-boy boss (Michael Rapaport) to create a hit series tailored for African Americans. Frustrated by the implicit racism that dominates the entertainment industry, Delacroix comes up with a show that he feels white America really wants to see, a minstrel show called ‘Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show’. His offensive joke backfires however when ‘Mantan’ becomes a runaway success. Lee takes firm pot shots at various institutions, interspersing the film with racially coded advertising and racist images from America’s shameful filmic past (including much loved American classics, “Birth of a nation” and “Gone with the wind”). Not surprising then that Lee dedicates the film to Budd Schulberg, the writer of Eliza Kazan’s 1957 media satire, “A face in the crowd”. Cast includes Jada Pinkett-Smith, Savion Glover and Tommy Davidson.

results.title: Bamboo: plant of a thousand uses
results.creator_credit: Robert Lang, Sterling S Beath and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: Although this is a film about the traditional and everyday uses of bamboo, it also portrays many aspects of contemporary living in Japan; life in urban centres and rural areas and aspects of agriculture, handicrafts, art and types of shelter are explored. This giant grass is noted for its beauty and commercial value and it provides a livelihood for many Japanese families.

results.title: Balzac
results.creator_credit: Jean Vidal, Les Films du Compas and AE Films
results.brief_description: Contemporary paintings, manuscripts and lithographs are used in this film depicting the life of Balzac, nineteenth century French novelist. Beginning with shots of the workroom in which Balzac wrote many of his novels, the film flashes back to the Napoleonic era during which the writer was born. The film traces his boyhood, his career, the mounting of his debts, his love affairs, and concludes with his death which came after he had recreated a whole society in his ninety-six novels.

results.title: Balto
results.creator_credit: Simon Wells, Steve Hickner, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, Balto is part husky/part wolf looking for a place to belong. An outcast in Alaska, he has few true friends - Boris the Russian snow goose, polar bear cubs Muk and Luk and the beautiful husky Jenna. Balto becomes a hero when the small town of Nome is struck by a diptheria epidemic. A blizzard means that medicine for the children cannot be delivered unless a team of sled dogs can race 600 miles to bring it back. When the dogs become lost, Balto must come to the rescue. Features the voices of Kevin Bacon, Bridget Fonda, Bob Hoskins and Phil Collins.

results.title: Baltic deputy
results.creator_credit: Iosif Kheifits, Alexander Zarkhi, Amkino Corporation and Lenfilm
results.brief_description:
This film depicts incidents in the life of the distinguished Russian scientist and former Oxford professor and scientist Klement Timiriazev (renamed in the film) who, despite ostracism by colleagues, joined the Bolsheviks in 1918 and became a hero of the revolution. ‘Baltic Deputy’ ably balances propaganda, action, humour and pathos, presenting a period of revolution and social upheaval through the eyes of one man.

Credits: Director, Alexander Zarkhi, Joseph Heifitz ; writer, Alexander Zarkhi, Joseph Heifitz, David Dell, Leonid Rakhmanov ; photography, Hoissaye Rakhmanov, M. Kaplan ; music, Nikolai Tomofeev.
Cast: Miriya Domasheva, Boris Livanov, Nikolai Cherkasov, Oleg Zhakov, Alexandr Melnikov, M. Dubrava

results.title: Balmain
results.creator_credit: Kit Guyatt and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Expresses the popular protest of residents in the inner Sydney suburb of Balmain against the industrial development of the foreshore as a major container shipping port. Discusses the historic buildings and traditional character of the area and the radical changes expected. Shows the problems of the city planning involved.

results.title: Balloons and spinifex
results.creator_credit: John Gray, Ian Dunlop, Shan Benson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The building of a weather station in the Australian desert, showing the work of those who run it and the use made of their reports by the Bureau of Meteorology. Based at the Giles Weather Station.
